title: Sri Lanka’s opposition SJB will form interim govt only if president steps down: MP
body_lines: ECONOMYNEXT – Sri Lanka’s main opposition the Samagi Jana Balavegaya (SJB) will establish an interim all-party  government only if President Gotabaya Rajapaksa steps down, SJB legislator Harsha de Silva said.

The MP tweeted Thursday (28) night that the president and the government has lost its legitimacy as a result of the wave of protests that have erupted around the country over Si Lanaka’s worsening economic crisis.

As discussed we will establish an interim all-party government w 113+ if @GotabayaR calls it a day. That is what the country is asking for. #GoHomeGota2022 #aragalaya is about that. He and his government has lost its moral legitimacy to stay on any longer. Let’s find a way out. https://t.co/mgQTAnAzWW

The opposition MP was responding to a remark by former sports minister and President Rajapaksa’s nephew Namal Rajapaksa who had said all parties must come together to form an interim government. Having two factions of the ruling Sri Lanka Podujana Peramuna (SLPP) will only extend the existing coalition, he said.
President Rajapaksa was scheduled to meet party leaders Friday (29) morning but reports said the meeting was postponed at the last minute.
Sri Lanka’s economic crisis has precipitated a political crisis resulting in widespread calls for the resignation of the president, Prime Minister Mahinda Rajapaksa and the cabinet of ministers.
Prime Minister Rajapaksa has stressed that he does not wish to step down, though a number of MPs of his own party have called for his resignation. (Colombo/Apr29/2022)
